properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 3:57AM CST until January 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Des Moines IA
properties.description:
...Winter Storm This Afternoon into Late Saturday...

.A large low pressure system will affect Iowa to end the week
spreading two episodes of wintry precipitation across the state.
The first push should bring snow and blowing snow through central
sections with freezing rain and a wintry mix south this
afternoon, both lasting into at least the evening hours. The
second push Saturday into the early evening hours east will
mainly be snow and blowing snow. Moderate to heavy snow
storm total accumulations are expected over the southeast two-
thirds of Iowa by the time the storm ends Saturday evening.

* WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow
accumulations of 5 to 7 inches by late Saturday. Ice
accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch with isolated
locations up to two tenths or more. Winds gusting as high as 40
mph this evening.

* WHERE...South central and southeast Iowa

* WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 6 PM CST Saturday.
Precipitation mainly in two episodes, this afternoon and this
evening, and again Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult with snow and ice
covered roads. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce
visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday
evening commute. Scattered power outages may occur.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 PM CST SATURDAY
